title: So the BUFF to Galio's ult is GREAT...

body:
But Riot, could I make *one* small request that could help Galio fulfill a real role as a tanky initiator like he's supposed to? Right now, he is *totally* immobile, which makes absolutely no sense because a winged gargoyle of all creatures should have at least a little mobility. Gailo's only hope for initiating a team fight right now is to flash into the enemy team, which is a risky and usually sub-optimal.

My suggestion is simple: his E is now a dash (hooray for no more flash engage) that functionally works exactly the same as the current skillshot, just with a reduced range of 900 from 1180 to make up for the improved mobility. Additionally, increasing the cooldown to 14/13/12/11/10 from 12/11/10/9/8 (or possibly higher) would help keep him from becoming *too* mobile. This ability then becomes an excellent engage tool that allows Galio to both dive in for clutch ults, and also speed up allies that are following him into the fray. This would be a slight nerf to full AP Galio since E *is* one of his two major wave clear options, but on Bruiser Galio (his intended role), it gives him options to make plays, and a tanky Galio would not risk as much from using a dash for a bit of wave clear.

What do you say Riot? Can we give Galio this one last change to bring him up to snuff?

**EDIT:** So a lot of people are commenting that this change would make Galio really OP, and I have to agree. *But*—and this is a big but—that is only because right now his kit is overloaded with false power that he can't really use effectively. He suffers from the exact same issues Maokai had before his rework last season; he has excessive damage and surprising power in a successful situation, but he like Maokai is far too unreliable in *any* meta to actually utilize that excessive power. When they reworked Maokai (who had been my main for almost 8 months), they nerfed his damage across the board *but he was still far stronger than before the changes*. Galio needs the same type of changes to bring him up to date, and if part of that means axing some extra false power, then so be it.

It'd be easier to just remove the cast time on E. It wouldn't make him too powerful, but would allow him to swiftly follow up with Q or R (I'd also like to see Q get a travel speed buff when travelling along the path of E)

Galio's a tough one. His ult's really reliant on flash to be a reliable initiator, so giving him a dash of some sort's definitely tempting. If we went down that route though we'd then have to strip things off Galio to balance him out. At present Galio does offer a distinct playstyle, in that he's very much a blend of mage and tank, with strengths and weaknesses from both sides. 

If we were to give him strong, regular initiation however we'd have to cut into those mages elements pretty noticeably to compensate. End result of that process is probably that Galio ends up looking like a pretty standard tank, with a dash to get himself into the fight, a slow to provide some stickiness, a powerful AOE CC, a little poke and low to moderate damage. There's a decent kit in there, but it's one that a number of other champions already offer. Pretty hesitant about going down that path without a clear idea of why that's right for Galio and how we keep a distinct identity for him (and why that's a good fit with the playstyle he currently has, his theme, what players like about him at present etc).

I don't think Riot needed to change Galio at all. The ult buff is unnecessary extra power; Galio already does plenty of damage with it because of his extra passive AP + the AP items he normally buys (ex: Abyssal Scepter). It's also on the worst possible place to buff Galio— his ultimate is arguably the most powerful part of his kit, and it's already extremely rewarding to land it properly.

It's a somewhat good thing for Galio that AP mages are currently somewhat mediocre compared to other roles (primarily assassins, AD especially) as things currently stand (due to the mana regen changes), or this buff might have made him too strong. He's fine, just underplayed (he's one of my most-played champions at this point; he's my go-to champion for countering Fizz, LeBlanc, Singed, Teemo, Malzahar, etc.).

If there's one place in Galio's kit that might be appropriate for buffing, it's his W. It could be changed to allow shielding of minions (possibly without the healing portion of the skill; Galio could abuse that for ridiculous laning sustain), shielding himself+the target (this would allow Galio more freedom in choosing who to shield; currently, he has to choose between buffing his damage *and* defensive stats by shielding himself or just giving an ally some resistances), and/or healing the target in addition to Galio.

A dash on Galio's E is really risky in terms of balance; he's already really good with just speed boosting/slowing on his Q and E. They're enough to set up a good ultimate if you use them properly. Even if you only get to ult the enemy's frontline, you're opening up the rest of the enemy team to your allies while the enemy frontliners are taunted, and though it's bad to force a champion to rely on Flash, Galio is currently balanced around burning Flash to perform the best possible ults. Imagine putting a dash on Annie— does she really need more mobility for deploying her ult+stun?
